metadata.title: CVE-2024-7730 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap buffer overflow was found in the virtio-snd device in QEMU. Whenreading input audio in the virtio-snd input callback, virtio_snd_pcm_in_cb,the function did not check whether the iov can fit the data buffer. Thisissue can trigger an out-of-bounds write if the size of the virtio queueelement is equal to virtio_snd_pcm_status, which makes the available spacefor audio data zero.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-7730` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
